sec.div: Island P. ater derived from other populations than those that colonized the Swedish mainland
sec.p: In view of the large geographical separation between the islands and their location to the east, south and west of the Swedish mainland, it is unlikely that the islands and the Swedish mainland got their populations from different sources. But most important, there is almost no variation in body size among continental P. ater over the northern Palearctic ( Snow, 1954, 1955), so there is no nearby place from which large birds could have been recruited.
